description: Cherries are small, round stone fruits that grow in clusters. Sweet cherries have firm, sweet flesh, while sour cherries are more tart. They have a single pit and come in various colors from deep red to yellow.

flavor_profile.notes: Sweet with subtle tartness and floral notes

storage_tips: Store fresh cherries in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Keep stems attached to maintain freshness. For longer storage, pit and freeze. Handle gently as they bruise easily.
preparation: Wash gently and remove stems. Pit the cherries by cutting around the stone or using a cherry pitter. For jams, can be used whole or halved. The natural sweetness makes excellent jams with good color.
